DataElement.preferredDefinition: The code system used to document patient interventions or procedures.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The source from which something comes or issues; to take, obtain, or receive from a source._An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._Executed and carried through to completion.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Professional society representing the field of dentistry.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An international system of medical classification used for procedural coding.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Published by the College of American Pathologists, the Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms is a combination of content of SNOMED Reference Terminology and READ codes.

Concepts.longName: Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms
Concepts.definition: Published by the College of American Pathologists, the Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms is a combination of content of SNOMED Reference Terminology and READ codes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A proprietary medical nomenclature of the American Medical Association widely used to report medical procedures and services under public and private health insurance programs.

Concepts.definition: A proprietary medical nomenclature of the American Medical Association widely used to report medical procedures and services under public and private health insurance programs.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.:a group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
A group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.
